CatDescriptText: Mr. Roland Smith, wrecker, 7516 Hamilton Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February, 28, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the morals of the community are better than they used to be, worse or about the same? If there is any change, what do you think caused it?" answer reads: "Judging from reading and discussions in which I participated in school concerning conditions between 25 and 30 years ago, I would say that I think that things are better now."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Roland Smith wearing light colored trench coat with collar and top button, standing on street corner, possibly Penn Avenue and Sixth Street, Downtown
